hackathon-description-text: Coding4TX's Hackathon at RetailMeNot brings students together to work with tech mentors and compete for prizes. All attendees will also get a free T-shirt plus free breakfast, lunch and snacks all day long from 9am - 5pm!
hackathon-eligibility:
Participants must be pre-registered on Splashthat.
All students must have a signed permission slip with media release to participate.
There are two tracks, one for Scratch and one for Thimble.
Teams should include no more than five students.
hackathon-requirements: EACH GROUP HAS 4 DELIVERABLES DUE TODAY:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 1st, 2nd and 3rd place teams in each track will be awarded prizes. Participants will also select a "student choice" prize for a team in each track.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=301 Congress Ave, Austin, TX 78701, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: The concept has been developed in a way that maximizes the benefit for the challenge. The concept needs to be unique, creative, and realistic. (10 pts)
Code is functional, free of glitches, contains comments and includes no copyrighted material. (50 pts)
Team delivers a demonstration of their prototype, the code is explained, Devpost submission is complete and includes photos, screenshots, and the project URL. (30 pts)
Team follows the Community Collaboration Agreements throughout the day and everyone is working together as a functional team. (10 pts)

hackathon-description-header: A Coding4TX student hackathon hosted by RetailMeNot
